intro: Hieracium diaphanoides subsp. grammolepium, commonly known as the translucent hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It is distinguished by its translucent, waxy leaves that give it a unique appearance. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and often locally distributed species.
